glossary.definition: A framework defining how employees are compensated (base salary, bonuses, equity, etc.)
A range of salary values for a specific position level or role
The complete compensation for an employee including base salary, bonuses, and benefits
The specific salary settings for an employee within a compensation structure

business_rules: Compensation structures must be defined before salary assignment
Salary must be within defined salary band for the position
Compensation changes require approval based on amount and type
Compensation history must be maintained for audit purposes
Salary configurations must comply with labor regulations
Compensation structures can vary by position, level, or department
Performance-based compensation requires performance evaluation completion
Salary bands must be updated periodically to reflect market rates
Compensation data must be kept confidential and access-controlled
calculations_or_formulas: Total compensation = base_salary + bonuses + equity_value + benefits_value
invariants: Salary must be within valid salary band for position
Compensation effective date must be valid (not in past unless retroactive)
Compensation structure must be defined before use
Compensation history must be maintained and immutable
Salary cannot be negative or zero
edge_cases: Salary increase exceeds band maximum - system flags violation, requires band update or exception approval
Compensation structure is updated - system handles current employees, may require migration or grandfathering
Retroactive compensation change - system backdates change, recalculates affected periods, maintains history
Performance bonus calculation fails - system flags error, uses fallback calculation or manual entry
Compensation approval is rejected - system maintains original compensation, logs rejection reason
Salary band is updated mid-year - system handles current salaries, may require adjustment or exception
Employee transfers to different compensation structure - system migrates compensation, maintains history
Compensation data is accessed without authorization - system logs access attempt, enforces access controls
compliance_requirements: Compensation data must be encrypted and access-controlled
Compensation changes must be approved by authorized personnel
Compensation history must be retained for legal compliance
Salary bands must comply with labor regulations and market standards
Compensation reporting must protect employee privacy
user_journeys: HR creates compensation structure - defines structure type and rules, structure is available for positions
HR defines salary bands - sets min/max for each level, bands are used for salary validation
HR configures employee salary - sets salary within band, compensation is active
Manager requests salary increase - submits request, approval workflow is triggered
Compensation change is approved - salary is updated, history is maintained, employee is notified
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Given compensation structure creation, when structure is defined, then structure is created and available for use
Given salary configuration, when salary is within band, then configuration is saved and compensation is active
Given compensation change request, when request is submitted, then approval workflow is triggered
Given compensation approval, when change is approved, then salary is updated and history is maintained
Given salary band update, when bands are modified, then current salaries are validated and flagged if outside bands
open_questions: What are the specific compensation structure types? (fixed? variable? hybrid?)
How are salary bands determined? (market data? internal equity? both?)
What is the approval workflow for compensation changes? (manager? HR? finance?)
How are performance-based compensations calculated? (formula? manual? hybrid?)
What is the process for retroactive compensation changes? (backdating? recalculation?)
How are compensation structures customized per department or role?
assumptions: Compensation structures define how employees are paid
Salary bands provide ranges for salary validation
Compensation history is maintained for audit
Compensation data is confidential and access-controlled
